subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More experiments.
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I've heard of the Hieronymus machine, but don't remember, or don't know what 
it is. I think what would help the plastic is that conductive spray coating 
that's used on laptop cases. I also wantt to try double sided copper clad PC 
board.

Frank-S


>From: Zack Widup <w9sz@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More experiments.
>Date: Mon, 16 Jul 2007 23:34:43 -0500 (CDT)
>
>On Mon, 16 Jul 2007, Frank Sumption wrote:
>
> > This time I made a small plastic echo box. I tried plastic years ago, 
>and it
> > didn't work, this time it seems to. The injection speaker accounts for 
>the
> > weaker voices I think, since it's an ear bud, and is 32 ohm, normal 
>speakers
> > are 8 ohms. More voices are in my folder.
> >
>
>There are so many different types of plastics with so many different
>characteristics ... ABS plastic, PVC, Delrin, acrylic, PTFE (teflon),
>Cyrolon ZX ...
>
>It might be interesting to experiment with different types and see what
>works the best.
>
>Anyone here ever build a Hieronymus machine?  I understand teflon (or
>fiberglass-teflon PC board material) works incredibly well for the
>"stick" sensor plate.
>
>Zack
>
